meanings.definition: regard or consider as unworthy or lacking in value
meanings.sent1: She disvalues her old toys now that she has new ones.
meanings.sent2: He disvalues the importance of honesty in relationships.
meanings.sent3: The cat disvalues the toy mouse, preferring the real thing.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions disvalues the trust others have in him.
meanings.sent5: The fading painting disvalues over time, losing its worth.

meanings.sent1: The company disvalues its products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Economic instability can disvalues the currency of a country.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick disvalues the value of the coin.
meanings.sent4: His negative comments disvalues the efforts of the team.
meanings.sent5: The wear and tear disvalues the antique furniture, reducing its price.

meanings.definition: to hold in low esteem or regard
meanings.sent1: She disvalues her own abilities, underestimating herself.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disvalues students who do not participate in class.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater disvalues any food that is not pizza.
meanings.sent4: His arrogant behavior disvalues the opinions of others.
meanings.sent5: The harsh criticism disvalues the hard work put into the project.
